edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.pedersenCmtKnowledge

Class SigmaPedersenCmtKnowledgeProverComputation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.pedersenCmtKnowledge.SigmaPedersenCmtKnowledgeProverComputation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DlogBasedSigma, SigmaProverComputation

    public class SigmaPedersenCmtKnowledgeProverComputation
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaProverComputation, DlogBasedSigma
    Concrete implementation of Sigma Protocol prover computation.

    This protocol is used for a committer to prove that the value committed to in the commitment (h, c) is x.

    The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 1.4 of pseudo codes document at http://cryptobiu.github.io/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode.pdf.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      • computeFirstMsg

        public SigmaProtocolMsg computeFirstMsg(SigmaProverInput in)
        Computes the first message of the protocol.

        "SAMPLE random values alpha, beta <- Zq

        COMPUTE a = (h^alpha)*(g^beta)".

        Specified by:
        computeFirstMsg in interface SigmaProverComputation
        Returns:

      • computeSecondMsg

        public SigmaProtocolMsg computeSecondMsg(byte[] challenge)
                                  throws CheatAttemptException
        Computes the second message of the protocol.

        "COMPUTE u = alpha + ex mod q and v = beta + er mod q".

        Specified by:
